title: LRATC Economies and Diseconomies of Scale

content.question: The graph above shows a firm’s long-run average total cost curve <math alttext="open parenthesis, L R A T C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>LRATC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true as the firm increases its scale of production?

choices.label: From zero output to <math alttext="Q sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the firm experiences diseconomies of scale.

From <math alttext="Q sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the firm experiences increasing returns to scale.

For output levels above <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the firm experiences diseconomies of scale.
At all output levels, the firm’s long-run marginal cost must be constant.

From <math alttext="Q sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="L R A T C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRATC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> falls because average fixed cost decreases; after <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="L R A T C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRATC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> rises due to diminishing returns to labor.

content.answer: For output levels above <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the firm experiences diseconomies of scale.
